reviews.text: Ready Player One is perfectly entertaining and enticing, but the sum of its parts ends up significantly less realized than its full potential.
reviews.author: Justin Kim

reviews.text: While the first half of [Ready Player One] is all trivia is the superior form of geekdom and awkward geekboy somehow managing to get the geekgirl interested the second half shows how you can form real communities online.
reviews.author: Maia Rose

reviews.text: Steven Spielberg delivers the ultimate expression of why we digest media, and possibly a glimpse into a world we could all be heading towards.
reviews.author: Tony Black

reviews.text: With Ready Player One, you can feel director Steven Spielberg pushing to reclaim his status as Hollywood's crowned head of spectacle as he pours his considerable talent into another memorable science-fiction fantasy.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: What Ready Player One does through its story is never quite as interesting as what it means, but its a Spielberg science-fiction pop culture souffle...
reviews.author: Cory Woodroof

reviews.text: An ugly FX monstrosity that misunderstands the misguided message of the book & fails to address its antiquated notions of race, gender and capitalism. Abysmal fan service from Spielberg, who should be able to shoot and edit a climax better than this
reviews.author: Joe Lipsett

reviews.text: A heckin fun movie, full of stunning action sequences and laughs and winks at the kids who grew up watching Back to the Future and Jurassic Park and E.T. and Indiana Jones.
reviews.author: Heather Hogan

reviews.text: Steven Spielberg has basically made the best possible version of this material with the serviceable-at-best script he was given.
reviews.author: Kip Mooney

reviews.text: If you go to the movies to watch big blockbusters with big explosions and effects, or to just have an enjoyable time with family and friends, then this is the movie for you.
reviews.author: Nicholas Oon

reviews.text: It's not nostalgia so much as a hyperactive computer algorithm.
reviews.author: Fletcher Powell

reviews.text: The setting of the film allows for some truly spectacular action set pieces and these are the strongest parts of the film
reviews.author: Nicolás Delgadillo

reviews.text: It's a film to watch and enjoy once, but probably not to return to again and again, like Spielberg's best. It's fixated on easter eggs and it's like an easter egg itself: shiny and pretty, inducing a brief sugar high, but ultimately hollow.
reviews.author: Olly Richards

reviews.text: Pure escapism that begs the question, Will there ever be a video game movie that really works?
reviews.author: Richard Crouse

reviews.text: While the video game preoccupation is adequately and thoroughly visualized, the real world has plenty of missing details.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: A kid at heart until his end, Spielberg's renegade sensibilities turns Ready Player One into a true treasure.
reviews.author: Dan Buffa

reviews.text: The film asks the viewer to find their purpose in life, like Wade has, so there isn't always this instant urge to run off to a different reality as found in video games, movies, or television.
reviews.author: Paul McGuire Grimes

reviews.text: While Ready Player One is an entertaining thrill ride, its storytelling still feels rather empty.
reviews.author: Matthew St. Clair

reviews.text: Most filmmakers fail miserably when trying to meld together both real and fantasy worlds, yet this is truly where Spielberg reminds us of his extraordinary talent.
reviews.author: Richard Propes

reviews.text: Even the most hardened of cynics can appreciate the take-away message: it's important to live in reality because it's the only thing that's real and the only place you can get a decent meal.
reviews.author: Jason Fraley

reviews.text: Ready Player One won't be remembered as Spielberg's worst film but it's not his best either. It's a purgatory state of a film that understands the appeal of the book but fails to convey those aspects in a satisfactory manner.
reviews.author: Kelechi Ehenulo

reviews.text: [I]t's a montage, an audiobook, and a love letter to the art that fuels us. But does it actually emulate the wonder of nostalgia itself? No, not even close.
reviews.author: Matt Cipolla

reviews.text: The character development and emotional stakes may be undercooked, but it's such a thrill to watch a filmmaker of Spielberg's pedigree unrestrained and having fun.
reviews.author: Allen Almachar

reviews.text: Ready Player One has found a way to bring a difficult-to-accurately-adapt book to the big screen in a way that fashions it into something new and exciting on its own.
reviews.author: Damond Fudge

reviews.text: It ultimately feels like a fan fiction gatekeeping exercise, saying loud and clear that if you don't love the right movies or comics or games, or don't appreciate them in the right way, you're not a real fan.
reviews.author: Brent McKnight

reviews.text: Like Thomas More making his case in Utopia, the example is so good it distracts from the point, leaving a lot of people scratching their heads at what it all means.
reviews.author: CJ Sheu

reviews.text: It's a film that, in addition to being prophetic, is very entertaining, but, above all, it reminds me of those movies and video games that have allowed me to daydream to travel to other realities. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: The film is overkill, it's in your face, and it's sensory overload; but it's also a great deal of fun.
reviews.author: Steven Prokopy

reviews.text: While it's doubtful the film will ever occupy a sacred place in the pantheon of its influences and it occasionally struggles to evoke that same feeling you had watching one of the many films it channels.
reviews.author: Dan Tabor

reviews.text: If escapism is what you're looking for in a popcorn movie, then Ready Player One is worth the price of admission.
reviews.author: Sarah Knight Adamson

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a lot of fun, but it also feels like the end of something. Now that Spielberg is filming his own fanfic, maybe postmodernism has reached its final form.
reviews.author: Chris McCoy

reviews.text: Steven Spielberg used his talents to make a movie with a cotton candy heart, and without the emotion his films usually have any good feelings won't last.
reviews.author: Julian Lytle

reviews.text: It's not just electronic. It's expressive. It's deep.
reviews.author: Lonita Cook

reviews.text: While it won't blow you away with its plot, Ready Player One delivers enough fun and adventure to more than justify the price of admission.
reviews.author: Kieran McLoone

reviews.text: The imperfect yet highly watchable Ready Player One will be something movie lovers will go back to again and again to find comfort in [Spielberg's] particular brand of escapist cinema.
reviews.author: Leslie Combemale

reviews.text: The kids loved it, the adults had their moments of fun. My favorite bit is the race. BUT... I will never love this film, and the reason is a very simple one: I couldn't help but be constantly reminded of a far better film.
reviews.author: Ard Vijn

reviews.text: A cinematic theme park ride of quite epic proportions.
reviews.author: Kate Rodger

reviews.text: Less about a nerd's worship of his hero than the loneliness of being worshipped by nerds ... In Ready Player One, finding mastery and satisfaction in reiterating the past is inherently melancholy.
reviews.author: Mel Campbell

reviews.text: This is eye candy at the extreme with so much detail you may want to see it again to catch all the references. But there are also many messages and issues that come up and make you think.
reviews.author: Linda and Al Lerner

reviews.text: No characters, lead or supporting, feel fully drawn out or have complete arcs.
reviews.author: Karl Delossantos

reviews.text: It doesn't bring us back to that Spielberg that gave us pure entertaining cinema at that time... but what he gives us here is so enjoyable that thinking about the negative points does not make much sense. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mikel Zorrilla

reviews.text: Its fantastic characters, its overwhelming musical selection, its incontestable performance, and, of course, an exciting sense of spectacle. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Víctor López G.

reviews.text: If the book is basically Fifty Shades of Grey for guys who have yet to discover their peckers, the film is a diverting slice of entertainment, offering enough surface thrills to justify its existence in a world already overloading on nostalgic feints.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: Even though it runs over two hours long, You become so engrossed in the story and the visuals that you don't notice the length - which says a lot about Ready Player One.
reviews.author: Allison Rose

reviews.text: To call Ready Player One superficial is irresponsible because that adjective has the word "super" in it. So Ready Player One is, at best, "ficial."
reviews.author: Ryan Syrek

reviews.text: A potent reminder that Spielberg is perhaps the greatest cinematic storyteller of our time.
reviews.author: Mattie Lucas

reviews.text: Tons of fun references, but not a lot of depth.
reviews.author: Erin Carson

reviews.text: If you are looking for a movie that reminds you why you fell in love with movies in the first place, get prepared for Ready Player One.
reviews.author: Kaitlyn Booth

reviews.text: A return of [Spielberg's] ability to...paint a picture cinematically that he knows is going to impress an audience.
reviews.author: Dan Murrell

reviews.text: Flawed though it may be, Ready Player One still has quite a bit to offer, especially for those with even the most rudimentary knowledge of pop culture.
reviews.author: Brent Hankins

reviews.text: If you enjoy gaming, wax lyrical about 80s entertainment... and appreciate action above under-developed personae, you will love Steven Spielberg's interpretation of Ready Player One.
reviews.author: Wendy Shreve

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a visual spectacle and Spielberg's most fun film in decades. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Nicolás Ruiz

reviews.text: There are definitely seeds of an interesting premise here, but unfortunately, they degenerate into a bundle of clichés overloaded with pop culture allusions.
reviews.author: Sameen Amer

reviews.text: This is a highly-entertaining movie that pays homage to tech gurus as well as pop culture, and should appeal to a wide audience of film fans, not just gamers.
reviews.author: S. Indra Sathiabalan

reviews.text: So in the end, my opinion on Ready Player One- the movie was good, fun ride that especially kids will love... But the book was great. That's my story and I'm sticking to it.
reviews.author: Rachel Wagner

reviews.text: If you're willing to enjoy Ready Player One superficially you'll have a good time. If you spend longer than five minutes thinking about it you'll consider it a crime against cinema.
reviews.author: Tom Bond

reviews.text: It's a repetition of the old bugaboos we know so well, packaged in a slick, CGI-heavy wrapping that is not as interesting as it wants to be.
reviews.author: Tomas Trussow

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a bit like catnip laced cocaine sprinkled atop crack filled Girl Scout Cookies. You probably can't live on it. It may even kill you. But it will be worth it.
reviews.author: Kenneth R. Morefield

reviews.text: Ready Player One isn't a transcendent piece of cinema. That's OK. It IS a well-made piece of popcorn entertainment that also manages to be an odd ouroboros of layered Spielbergian nostalgia-ception.
reviews.author: Allen Adams

reviews.text: [Steven] Spielberg chooses to embrace a more optimistic approach, and it's a change that's both refreshing and engaging in a way few directors could pull off.
reviews.author: Andrea Thompson

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a no-brainer, must-see in theaters. It's such a fun movie that you'll probably want to see it again.
reviews.author: Emmanuel Noisette

reviews.text: ... sensorially exhausting pyrotechnics.
reviews.author: Filipe Freitas

reviews.text: It's a movie with a storytelling approach that feels as old and cliched as some of the inspirations it's trying to evoke.
reviews.author: Kyle Pinion

reviews.text: Dishes out a liberal serving of memberberries piled-high atop a generic, hollow bowl.
reviews.author: Louisa Moore

reviews.text: An old-fashioned, though state-of-the-art, frolic ... Viewers need not be cut-throat Trivial Pursuit players to know Blondie from Buckaroo Banzai, though it wouldn't hurt.
reviews.author: Kent Turner

reviews.text: The story is fairly conventional ... the cast is only mostly successful ... but the relevance of it all and complete sense of wonder ... make it a trip worth taking ...
reviews.author: Colby Bryant

reviews.text: Ready Player One, despite its pedigreed director, amiable cast, and eye-popping visuals, mistakes tired references and slick action sequences for personality
reviews.author: Di Golding

reviews.text: READY PLAYER ONE proves a canny surprise. It is rare that movies triumph over their source material, but this is one such case.
reviews.author: Tim Stevens

reviews.text: Pop culture fans will find something to love in this fun thrill ride.
reviews.author: John Hanlon

reviews.text: Ready Player One might not be Spielberg's worst film, but it is his most impersonal.
reviews.author: Alistair Ryder

reviews.text: There's a touch of Spielbergian magic that transcends the choppy, patchwork narrative. It's very difficult not to have an immense amount of fun with Ready Player One in spite of its flaws.
reviews.author: Brian Gill

reviews.text: Perhaps the most compelling thing Ready Player One and the OASIS provides is the glimpse at our inevitable future.
reviews.author: Kent Garrison

reviews.text: Despite its many issues, Ready Player One is still an enjoyable ride that ticks all the boxes of a big summer blockbuster.
reviews.author: Kt Schaefer

reviews.text: The dazzling visual flurry on screen is both amazing and emotionally draining, often to the point of excess.... Ready Player One elevates itself beyond genre fodder.
reviews.author: Matt Ward

reviews.text: Far from perfect but almost obnoxiously entertaining.
reviews.author: Matt Oakes

reviews.text: A once-great filmmaker has taken on a new avatar less heroic than Parzival. It is the avatar of a pandering crowd-pleaser.
reviews.author: Armond White

reviews.text: Spielberg's dreamy love letter to pop culture is a pure joy to take in, hypnotic and grin-inducing in its references, with an unadulterated sense of magic.
reviews.author: Cameron Frew

reviews.text: It's certainly a far more nutritious experience than the book...and I certainly wouldn't begrudge anyone wanting to escape the depressing world we live in for a few hours to enjoy it.
reviews.author: Jennifer Heaton

reviews.text: [It's] almost like you can feel Spielberg on autopilot, thinking about more interesting, challenging projects he'll be working on when this is done re-affirming his box-office credentials.
reviews.author: Bob Chipman

reviews.text: As a focus for our own nostalgia-based serotonin triggers, it's a complete success. As a stand-alone story, not so much. But hey! Pretty shiny things!
reviews.author: Johnny Gayzmonic

reviews.text: It delivers on every level fans have been hoping. It may even be better than its sometimes problematic source material.
reviews.author: Kirsten Acuna

reviews.text: Although there are some fun sequences and genuine wonder to behold, the film is a pandering, noisy, visual mess with a thin plot and even thinner characters.
reviews.author: Harris Dang

reviews.text: It's Spielberg's sloppiest film since Hook, but still has enough moments that transcend simple nostalgia to make it worthwhile even if it is an uneven thrill ride.
reviews.author: Sean Mulvihill

reviews.text: If you're impressed by a wave of nostalgic nods to the past, at the expense of anything remotely interesting itself, this is really the film for you.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: A lot of Ready Player One feels like the audience is watching a video game, but this is one time when I didn't mind not playing.
reviews.author: Micheal Compton

reviews.text: There are literally no creative decision-makers of color who helped bring Ready Player One into being. And it shows.
reviews.author: Li Lai

reviews.text: READY PLAYER ONE is the prime example of just how hollow big budget filmmaking has become and ranks as one of the worst movies Spielberg has ever made, even though it represents an amalgamation of what has made his movies so iconic.
reviews.author: Alex Maidy

reviews.text: The silver screen has rarely felt so lacking in allure, which is either the complete opposite of the point that Spielberg is trying to make or the absolute epitome of it.
reviews.author: Aaron Leggo

reviews.text: "Ready Player One" is an engrossing thrill ride that feeds off of your pop culture nostalgia.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: RPO is a movie with a tsunami of these moments from about 40 years of film, T.V and gaming. If you're a collector, you may relish trying to catch them all.
reviews.author: Blake Howard

reviews.text: There is a beating heart behind the glossy technical craft here, a real respect for the pop culture that so dictates everything about the film's universe.
reviews.author: Ross Miller

reviews.text: At one point it might simply be too much. But that's part of the experience. Like some rides you're left dazed by the end, but you might just want to go back for another round.
reviews.author: Alci Rengifo

reviews.text: It's definitely not the book-and that's good. Unfortunately, however, it's not a great movie either.
reviews.author: Jared Mobarak

reviews.text: If Spielberg had found a way to inject even a bit of the warmth, wonder, and intelligence we associate with some of his best-loved films, this might have been something special.
reviews.author: Adam Lubitow

reviews.text: It's a win across the board...when Spielberg decides to use a piece of pop culture or nostalgia, he uses it as an integral part of the story.
reviews.author: John Campea

reviews.text: Ready Player One feels empty when you explore its characters, and tries to have its cake and eat it too with the climactic message, which feels downright incongruous with everything thrown at us during the previous two hours.
reviews.author: Akhil Arora

reviews.text: It's pure entertainment, and gives Spielberg an easel to prop his sentimental painting on, and all the colors on his palette to do so.
reviews.author: Robert Daniels

reviews.text: There are so many times that Ready Player One could have wrestled with its nostalgia love or more problematic elements, but instead it's just a movie with no there there.
reviews.author: Terence Johnson

reviews.text: Definitely a film worthy of your quarters.
reviews.author: Rendy Jones

reviews.text: Ready Player One is literally a gamer's paradise, a dazzling film that never seems to slow down.
reviews.author: Annie Banks

reviews.text: A fun film that can be enjoyed whether you read the book or not.
reviews.author: Sarah Gopaul

reviews.text: Creating escapism is what Spielberg is all about, and he nails it with "Ready Player One."
reviews.author: Pamela Powell

reviews.text: Nerds and gamers are more than simply white men of a certain age, guys. Give us all characters we can enjoy and embrace.
reviews.author: Kimberly Pierce

reviews.text: Ready Player One is weighed down by so much nostalgia and pop culture references while being devoid of everything else.
reviews.author: Mae Abdulbaki

reviews.text: For all of the fun that "Ready Player One" thinks it is having, if you look behind the curtain of its stratagems you'll find a ho-hum young adult sci-fi movie.
reviews.author: Tom Santilli

reviews.text: A stunning piece of popcorn cinema... one big budget blockbuster worth immersing yourself in ASAP.
reviews.author: Andrew Pollard

reviews.text: A juicy wad of bubblegum entertainment, visually antic and immersive without feeling assaultive, fast-paced without feeling rushed.
reviews.author: Rob Gonsalves

reviews.text: The movie is cynical and manipulative because the '80s it exploits means nothing to Spielberg. He uses items from that decade because he noticed that's what kids are into...
reviews.author: A.S. Hamrah

reviews.text: Ready Player One isn't the Spielberg home run that fans of the book may have hoped it would be, but it's a solid double and a good time that is almost perversely suited for home viewing.
reviews.author: Joe Reid

reviews.text: A fantastic, mind blowing amalgam of "Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory," "Tron," and "The Matrix"...
reviews.author: Felix Vasquez Jr.

reviews.text: Under the barrage of 1980s macho-nerd pandering, the whole thing is just more exhausting than it should be.
reviews.author: Chelsea Phillips-Carr

reviews.text: Not a lot of attention is paid to the troubling implications of living your life in a make-believe space, but the adventure moves fast enough to prevent the viewer from worrying too much about it.
reviews.author: Dominic Corry

reviews.text: The movie doesn't understand what it means to turn the Iron Giant into a weapon, and worse, neither do the characters. There's no actual nostalgia in this nostalgic epic.
reviews.author: Lindsay Ellis

reviews.text: Tailor made for Spielberg with an adventurous heart and an accessible screenplay.
reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: ...just another ill-conceived and executed endeavor from a director well past his prime.
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: The end result is a a confusing and muddled message about the "purity" of fandom.
reviews.author: Meg Downey

reviews.text: A $175 million, effect-laden sci-fi epic that's pitched at the level of a Tonight Show With Jimmy Fallon sketch- it's "hey, remember that thing: The Movie" (Living Life Fearless)
reviews.author: Stephen Silver

reviews.text: A cross between a thrill ride and a particularly satisfying video game... it's the kind of movie you need to see over and over again.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: [The film] serves as testament to Spielberg's gift as a pulse-riding, intuitively cinematic entertainer....a film full of grandly staged cyber battles and real-world intrigue. And thankfully it's one of the few long films to warrant its running time.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: the film improves as it goes on, especially in the second half, where Spielberg generates a successful tension in juxtaposing action taking place simultaneously within the real world and the OASIS
reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: Being brave enough to take the leap is the theme of Steven Spielberg's visually dazzling fantasy that seamlessly morphs from its apocalyptic reality into a world limited only by our imagination.
reviews.author: Louise Keller

reviews.text: Even though these heroes are simplistic... Spielberg makes sure their motives and goals are transparent, the force driving us breathlessly to the movie's climax.
reviews.author: John Serba

reviews.text: Wow, what a massive cluster...um...you know... the film is. This would-be player tried her best to be ready, but sometimes - sorry, Hamlet - the readiness isn't all.
reviews.author: Eleanor Ringel Cater

reviews.text: Ready Player One dares to redo nostalgia. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: David Tejero Nogales

reviews.text: Spielberg demonstrates the impact pop culture has had on people's lives - an effect for which he is largely responsible. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Cristina Vales

reviews.text: Steven Spielberg's inner child has given us untold worlds of wonder. Now, it seems, the time has come to pay the piper.
reviews.author: J. Olson

reviews.text: The important thing is that the story is absorbing and the characters endearing, so the plot is still exciting despite being predictable, pure Spielberg style. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos Díaz Reyes

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a joy, wherever you see it. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alejandro Alemán

reviews.text: Even though I'm not the target audience, and even though it went on too long and sagged somewhat in the last half, I was carried away by the gorgeous special effects, the energy and Spielberg's sheer joy in filmmaking.
reviews.author: Diane Pershing

reviews.text: There will be many who jump for joy over this new invention of Spielberg. How I envy their ecstasy. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos Boyero

reviews.text: With its narrative slight and familiar, and its sense of drama and threat muted, it relies upon its roster of recognisable properties - and the affection everyone has for them, especially off-screen - to provide interest.
reviews.author: Sarah Ward

reviews.text: Ready Player One is popcorn entertainment that everyone can enjoy.
reviews.author: Oggs Cruz

reviews.text: Sputters out after a fast start.
reviews.author: Bob Grimm

reviews.text: More high nostalgia than high art, it is what it wants to be: an on-screen feel-good easily digestible celebration of beloved fandoms.
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a feast of nostalgia, action and visual style, which more than makes up for its fairly minor narrative shortfalls.
reviews.author: Tim Martain

reviews.text: The years go by and the most famous American director is still the best at what he does. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Daniel Krauze

reviews.text: There is nothing to recommend the film itself, which may as well have been assembled by the soulless corporate drones that it purports to hold in such contempt.
reviews.author: Alex Doenau

reviews.text: Few 21st century American films are as intertwined with the culture we live in as Ready Player One.
reviews.author: Jeff Simon

reviews.text: It's a clever, stylish, entertaining blockbuster designed to give one's inner child the cinema equivalent of a sugar rush.
reviews.author: Gary Dowell

reviews.text: As you would expect from a Spielberg film, the production values are first rate, with great special effects and great visuals, especially the stunning way the digital world of Oasis appears. The acting, and of course the direction, are both solid.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: Ready Player One is the first Spielberg film I can remember that feels contemptuous.
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: For all its ferocious energy, Ready Player One strikes me as the product of a cinema of exhaustion-it's a film about having come too far and being at the end of something, where extraordinary things no longer mean much, or have become toxic.
reviews.author: Jonathan Romney

reviews.text: Floods the senses with dazzling imagery but it reaches overload. Its about not being happy with yourself. Then something extraordinary happens. A scene so unique, so bizarre that it knocks off being eaten by Godzilla.
reviews.author: Victoria Alexander

reviews.text: An overlong, meandering mess, and a stain on Spielberg's CV; it's certainly the least satisfying film of his I can remember seeing.
reviews.author: CJ Johnson

reviews.text: ...it's just so hollow, and the characters so shallow, and the world so unexamined that Ready Player One never gets off the ground.
reviews.author: Sarah Marrs

reviews.text: It is, despite Spielberg's claims, neither a purehearted popcorn flick nor a Paul Verhoevenesque subversion, but something uneasily in between, cowed by the idea of the fanboy demographic.
reviews.author: Alison Willmore

reviews.text: But more often than not, it falls into the same trap, preferring to throw reference after reference at the screen without exploring why the sources of those references resonate with the characters, or the audience.
reviews.author: Abby Olcese

reviews.text: It's an effective cinematographic exercise in which nostalgia plays a key role and more proof that there is no one better than Steven Spielberg to make commercial films. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jonathan Eslui

reviews.text: I enjoyed it enough to feel as if I'd gotten a real theatrical experience out of it - but I also felt exhausted by the experience and a little bit sad for what it represented...
reviews.author: Wade Major

reviews.text: Ready Player One captures the gee-whiz youthful triumphalism of the Reagan era, all right, but it never explores the deeper question of whether all that is worth rehashing - over and over.
reviews.author: Margot Harrison

reviews.text: It's a film that evokes pure nostalgia...it should be enjoyed with loved ones. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Adrián Ruiz

reviews.text: Turns out that treating the movies entirely as a jungle gym brings out Peter Pan's inner brat. He's made a movie for lost boys.
reviews.author: Adam Nayman

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a pageant of now-dated pop culture references, an elaborate feat of CGI and copyright clearance, with images from games and movies speeding past, to the tune of Van Halen and A-Ha.
reviews.author: Pamela Hutchinson

reviews.text: Ready Player One might be the best film of 2018 so far. At the very least, it's the most fun you'll have at the movies anytime soon.
reviews.author: Cameron Meier

reviews.text: Spielberg's message about not losing touch with reality and corporate takeovers may be too obvious, but the glorious visuals will captivate you to the end.
reviews.author: Joanne Soh

reviews.text: I was locked in from the beginning. They got me into the world...really good movie.
reviews.author: Kristian Harloff

reviews.text: It's a lot to take in, but it doesn't feel overwhelming...you enjoy what this movie does to you.
reviews.author: Mark Ellis

reviews.text: Ready Player One becomes a reflection on the very meaning of fantasy cinema, of movies in general. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fausto Fernandez

reviews.text: This is an adventure movie from the all-time master of them, Steven Spielberg.
reviews.author: Andy Howell

reviews.text: See it on the biggest screen possible. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Rafael Rosales Santos

reviews.text: Remarkable. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Diego Batlle

reviews.text: But, once this sucker gets rolling, it becomes a visual thrill ride that is simultaneously a celebration and condemnation of the entertainment industrial complex.
reviews.author: Mathew DeKinder

reviews.text: The fact that Ready Player One's best scene has little to do with video games feels like it means something.
reviews.author: Kristian M. Lin

reviews.text: In fact, it appears, for a moment, to be barreling toward a potent critique of the book and the broader culture of the privileged, young white millionaire men of Silicon Valley. Unfortunately, it stumbles at the finish line.
reviews.author: Chris Plante

reviews.text: Pop-culture references are no substitute for brains in this overly frenetic, poorly written blockbuster.
reviews.author: Tom Glasson

reviews.text: This film is pure joy and the epitome of what we hope for when we go to the movies.
reviews.author: Danny Minton

reviews.text: Self-indulgent and far too long, but plenty of retro fun here for pop culture geeks, with Spielberg casting off the recent seriousness of The Post to become what he does best.
reviews.author: Alison Rowat

reviews.text: A visual spectacle so overwhelming as joyful that it does not give the viewer respite in his uninterrupted succession of adventures. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ernesto Diezmartinez

reviews.text: As long as you're willing to ask little in the way of intellectual or emotional stimulation, Ready Player One is a great day out.
reviews.author: Imogen West-Knights

reviews.text: The visuals of Ready Player One really are ingenious, though the conglomeration of homages do not always mix well and it becomes a bit of a hodgepodge. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Paula Arantzazu Ruiz

reviews.text: It's vibrant, it's colorful, and it was a lot of fun...this movie is all about the celebration of geek culture.
reviews.author: Andre Meadows

reviews.text: The film is necessarily derivative, but hardly ever witty...It's entertaining by and large, but left me wanting less.
reviews.author: Paul Whitington

reviews.text: [Steven Speilberg's] still got the old magic.
reviews.author: Tom Shone

reviews.text: It's a pop culture geek out, but also visually stunning and good fun even for non-gamers.
reviews.author: Aine O'Connor

reviews.text: Emotionally it's completely flat - the main characters struggle to make it out of two dimensions, the linear storyline is a far-from-thrilling treasure hunt, and any potential romance feels formulaic, forced and rather feeble.
reviews.author: Matthew Bond

reviews.text: It says here you'll at least consider going back to watch "Player One" again to find more tidbits you missed the first time.
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: It's official - Ready Player One is Steven Spielberg's worst film.
reviews.author: Chris Evangelista

reviews.text: I saw the film in IMAX, and a week later I'm still waiting for the safe return of my optic nerves, but it was the meagre emotional charge that shocked me most.
reviews.author: Anthony Lane

reviews.text: Underwhelming, overlong and breezy sci-fi blockbuster. It's an ironic ode to pop culture, geeks and virtual reality.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: 'Ready Player One' is an exemplary blockbuster, a film that conveys fun in a way only Spielberg can achieve. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sebastian Zavala Kahn

reviews.text: A boring, vapid and tedious video game that lacks a heart, mind, soul, personality or anything else that's part of the spectrum of humanism. It's yet another addition to Hollywood's "bread and circuses."
reviews.author: Avi Offer

reviews.text: Ready Player One is the dream of every geek and pop culture aficionado. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Orlando Maldonado

reviews.text: An adventure tale whose plot revolves around the pleasures of losing yourself in fantasy worlds, Ready Player One is ... a giddy rush of a movie that zips along on a tide of breathless action and boundless pop-culture trivia.
reviews.author: Jason Best

reviews.text: The movie cares more about all the nostalgia and easter eggs than and actual story. It beats you over the head and forces you to look at it. All the visual flair in the world can't disguise an empty experience
reviews.author: Michelle Alexandria

reviews.text: This is fun while it lasts but I would have liked a little more humour and a lot more soul. I pray the retro revival has now hit its peak.
reviews.author: Andy Lea

reviews.text: This is hardly Spielberg's most creative genre work - but...it does speak to the joyful, unapologetic classicism of his film-making style.
reviews.author: Simran Hans

reviews.text: Bright, shiny, packed to the brim with detail, and totally without passion.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: The anti-Matrix, celebrating obeisance to random yet tethering nostalgia within a river of brands and platforms and delusions from the 1980s, critiquing lightly but eventually embracing the machine: any machine.
reviews.author: Ray Pride

reviews.text: Overstuffed, escapist action adventure, brimming with flashy eye candy and fantastic fanboy ferocity.
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: Ready Player One does what it sets out to do: it entertains, it flatters, it moves. Hard to ask for much more than that from a big budget blockbuster.
reviews.author: Sonny Bunch

reviews.text: Escapist fun made for mandatory repeat viewings to try to catch all the characters and icons hidden throughout. With READY PLAYER ONE, Spielberg has crafted an electronic Wonderland that is a love song to fandom and pop culture itself.
reviews.author: Diva Velez

reviews.text: With Spielberg, one has come to expect much, and so when presented with is flick that is only intermittently fun, and never buoyant, one comes away disappointed, and feeling just a little bit cheated.
reviews.author: Andrea Chase

reviews.text: Another disappointment from Steven Spielberg. He has come a long way down from the heart warming charm of "E T" to this cold and brassy virtual reality escapade.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: It hums with Spielberg's unmatched formal elasticity. But it's also a shrill, soulless piece, lacking the sense of wonder - or even an interrogation of such - essential to its director's best work.
reviews.author: Luke Goodsell

reviews.text: An exhilarating ride as good as or better than most other films of its type.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: The offering is quite a fun and frenetic blast, and is far, far better than that initial movie trailer suggested. (Full Content Review for Parents - Violence, Profanity, Nudity, etc. - also Available)
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: Ready Player One may be a movie about the future, but it is damningly a product of our present.
reviews.author: K. Austin Collins

reviews.text: Spielberg's film, which could have done so much more, does not improve on the novel. It's a missed opportunity.
reviews.author: Aakash Karkare

reviews.text: A one-of-a-kind thrill ride that provides an abundance of fun.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: I'm here to report that you can still have a good time at Ready Player One even if you don't get most of the references.
reviews.author: Lili Loofbourow

reviews.text: [Filled] with some truly wondrous sequences that confirm the director can still craft thrilling popcorn entertainment better than anyone on the planet.
reviews.author: Simon Foster

reviews.text: At its core, Ready Player One does embody the emotional and nostalgic side of Spielberg and celebrated pop culture like only someone who was creating it at the time could have.
reviews.author: Tyler Carlsen

reviews.text: It's a little hard not to feel like the emperor isn't wearing any clothes.
reviews.author: Alissa Wilkinson

reviews.text: The challenges are exciting, extensive, and surprising, and few if any directors are better at staging these kinds of action set pieces than Spielberg.
reviews.author: Kirk Baird

reviews.text: Just like Halliday's contest, Ready Player One is designed to reward the nerdiest among us.
reviews.author: Christopher Lawrence

reviews.text: It's a premise that could have been so much more, but instead it's a narrative that's more of a generic video game plot within a generic video game plot within a relatively basic movie
reviews.author: Matt Miller

reviews.text: Ready Player One feels long played out.
reviews.author: Tom Meek

reviews.text: Spielberg's adaptation is a improvement from Cline's novel, repairing its flaws and embracing nostalgia in the right ways to make one of his finest blockbusters in years.
reviews.author: Ross Bonaime

reviews.text: But with unruffled confidence and youthful velocity, the 71-year-old gambles that the thrills would override the insincerity -- that nobody would mind the self-defeating scruples as long as the breakneck ride keeps us glued.
reviews.author: Kong Rithdee

reviews.text: Spielberg has a frighteningly plausible vision of our near future, but he lacks the courage to follow through on its implications.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: ... features a playful sense of adventure likely to unite gamers past and present without sacrificing mainstream appeal.
reviews.author: Todd Jorgenson

reviews.text: Ready Player One needs to throw as many shiny things with nostalgic value at you as it can to cover up how boring the entire affair is.
reviews.author: Kristen Lopez

reviews.text: Ready Player One is more like a seven-course banquet made up entirely of Pixie Stix and Pop Rocks-you certainly get a rush from it for a little while but once the initial effect, there is not much of anything else going for it but overindulgence.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: It may be impossible to separate Ready Player One from its references, and without the Easter eggs, inside jokes, and endless homages, Ready Player One doesn't offer much that is unique to itself.
reviews.author: Roxana Hadadi

reviews.text: To quote from yet another famous '80s reference, go ahead and gag me with a spoon.
reviews.author: Piers Marchant

reviews.text: Spielberg wants us to drop the techno-gadgets and join hands, but it's the VR world that really juices him. He's the ultimate fanboy making a movie about the need to move beyond being a fan.
reviews.author: Peter Rainer

reviews.text: Intense virtual reality adventure will dazzle '80s fans.
reviews.author: Sandie Angulo Chen

reviews.text: I'm sure that some will be more receptive to the avalanche of nostalgia than others... but I don't think one can deny the [film's] comment on the place of popular culture in our lives. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Emmanuel Báez

reviews.text: Busy and hectic but not cohesive, a game that's nothing more than a game.
reviews.author: Eric D. Snider

reviews.text: Those who haven't read the book will love this fantasy trip down 1980s memory lane. Fans of the novel will be horrified.
reviews.author: Gary Wolcott

reviews.text: A fun, imaginative take on Ernest Cline's novel. So why does it leave us wanting more?
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: Really is fun in some ways. But there's a suffocating abundance of digital imagery, and after a while, you feel as if you're staring at nothingness made manifest.
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: It's a fitting summation of Spielberg's career: occasional nods to the real world, but really preferring a world of fantasy and eternal adolescence.
reviews.author: Daniel M. Kimmel

reviews.text: Spielberg has created an experience so enthralling you will want to watch it again and again.
reviews.author: Jamie East

reviews.text: Where the old Spielberg magic comes into play are the points at which the virtual game world starts spilling into real world.
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: It's a whole lot of CGI fun going along for the ride, even one that lasts two hours and 19 minutes.
reviews.author: Brian Viner

reviews.text: It's a fun romp but lacks any real sense of menace or consequence.
reviews.author: Stefan Kyriazis

reviews.text: So much of Ready Player One is assembled from the detritus of our past that it is less a film and more an overstuffed cultural recycling bin.
reviews.author: Barry Hertz

reviews.text: A fantasy about rejecting fantasy that's built on movie fantasy clichés.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: A blast of pure childlike amusement.
reviews.author: Adam Graham

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a two-hour joyful pop culture celebration, a non-stop but not exhausting visual extravaganza that feels fresh and old-school at the same time.
reviews.author: Rebecca Murray

reviews.text: Fans of Ernest Cline's book are already grumbling about the changes and omissions in this expansive, expensive adaptation. I enjoyed the film more than I expected to--but felt that it went on too long and squandered its potential in the process.
reviews.author: Leonard Maltin

reviews.text: Mainly a computer generated animation extravaganza, the character development of the novel is jettisoned in favor of a chase narrative that compresses so much story that the entire affair seems rushed and over-labored.
reviews.author: Jonathan W. Hickman

reviews.text: Spielberg's "Ready Player One": Pop Culture 101
reviews.author: Charles Koplinski

reviews.text: The good news is, it's Steven Spielberg. The not-so-good news: The Spielberg sci-fi magic is missing in this adaptation of Ernest Cline's young-adult novel...all in all, Spielberg would do well to return to the real world.
reviews.author: Rashid Irani

reviews.text: Life in the OASIS is exciting and wondrous to behold through your avatar's oversized anime eyes, but it doesn't mean much without some real-world stakes, and that's where the film stumbles, badly.
reviews.author: Matthew Lickona

reviews.text: The film does a good job balancing and, in a few cases, overlapping the virtual and real worlds - though anyone from the future will tell you that you don't run down a street wearing VR goggles.
reviews.author: Chris Knight

reviews.text: RPO is sort of Philip K. Dick-lite.
reviews.author: Paul Chambers

reviews.text: Sensory overload with a heart.
reviews.author: Dustin Putman

reviews.text: A nightmare of nothingness, of empty, soulless w*nkery, that serves only to reassure male dorks that their pop-culture obsessions make them special, and will make cute girls like them.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: ...this failed the watch test miserably as I didn't know if I would actually survive almost 2 1/2 hours of watching all this nonsensical gobbledygook. But it will probably gross a billion dollars.
reviews.author: Tony Medley

reviews.text: Cline's world and Spielberg's vision of it mesh as well as John Ford and the Old West.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: A pop-culture smorgasbord with eerily prescient themes.
reviews.author: Annlee Ellingson

reviews.text: There's still something a little icky about a movie that data-mines the pop culture past of middle-aged men so shamelessly. Instead of us having to put away childish things, they're starring in a movie.
reviews.author: Rob Thomas

reviews.text: While Spielberg revels in this stuff, he's also playing the role of concerned elder, cajoling these crazy kids to go outside and get some fresh air. Maybe that's why the movie's relentless fun feels just a little conflicted.
reviews.author: Robert Horton

reviews.text: Of course, splendid visual effects would be nothing without good composition and Spielberg's control of the camera and expertise in crafting an action sequence is nonpareil, ultimately making Ready Player One the greatest movie to see in 3D since Avatar.
reviews.author: Musanna Ahmed

reviews.text: Visually sophisticated and full of invention, the movie harkens back to one of Spielberg's career sweet spots: the 1980s.
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: Spielberg's skillful pacing keeps the visual stimulation focused, such as in a thrilling car chase early on where Wade races the time-traveling Delorean from Back to the Future against a fleet of competitors.
reviews.author: Josh Terry

reviews.text: Ready Player One is big fun, to be sure. But its chances of enduring into 22nd-century pop consciousness seems improbable.
reviews.author: Randall King

reviews.text: In the hands of Spielberg, much of the pop culture junk that would feel gratuitous in other hands have a certain emotional resonance in his.
reviews.author: Will Leitch

reviews.text: As it stands, the movie is, like its central conceit, just a place to forget our problems and have fun for a couple of hours. But at least, for once, it's fun the whole country can have together.
reviews.author: Megan Basham

reviews.text: In 100 years, when film scholars are looking back at the career of Steven Spielberg... Ready Player One will be used as the primary piece of evidence to showcase the best and worst of the director.
reviews.author: Gregory Wakeman

reviews.text: If a film could collapse in on itself, due to its slavish devotion to a specific subset of 1980s entertainment, Ready Player One would be that black hole.
reviews.author: Al Hoff

reviews.text: Haptics weren't needed to feel the emotional pull of his best films; they aimed for the heart and hit much more often than they missed. "Ready Player One" aims for the adrenal gland.
reviews.author: Joe Morgenstern

reviews.text: Ready Player One certainly isn't just a film, it's an experience. It's a game... and we all win.
reviews.author: Tonja Renée Stidhum

reviews.text: Ready Player One is Spielberg's gigantic love letter to his alternate world inhabited by all cinema. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Erick Estrada

reviews.text: It's all blind, superficial adoration devoid of the very sort of adult perspective it so desperately requires.
reviews.author: Nick Schager

reviews.text: The VR world feels like watching someone play a multiplayer game, but it's action-packed, incredibly skillfully done, and often wonderful, as when the hero finds himself in 1980's The Shining.
reviews.author: Tim Appelo

reviews.text: By jettisoning pretty much everything but the bare skeleton of the plot and characters while expanding the scope beyond the 1980s, Steven Spielberg's film adaptation climbs its way up to exhausting, headache-inducing mediocrity.
reviews.author: Sherilyn Connelly

reviews.text: It's the decade in which Spielberg shaped so many of our pop-culture ideals, and with Ready Player One, he is masterfully back in the game, and that makes us all winners.
reviews.author: Michael Smith

reviews.text: Many of the book's references to Spielberg's cultural artifacts have been stripped away, but he imbibes the movie with flashes of colour and heart that rekindle a sense of wonderment that will transport many viewers back to their childhoods.
reviews.author: Mark Daniell

reviews.text: Why does Steven Spielberg always make the same mistake? Every time he tries to make technology and artificial reality the guts of the story, instead of the means of telling a story, he makes a great big-budget mess.
reviews.author: Katherine Monk

reviews.text: Amid this special-effects maelstrom, Wade Watts never emerges as a character, and the taciturn Sheridan is in constant danger of being out-acted by his own avatar. Who can connect with a hero when he's just watching the story?
reviews.author: J. R. Jones

reviews.text: For all of its many flaws, Ready Player One is hugely entertaining without ever coming close to the masterpiece status of Spielberg's earliest and genre-defining work.
reviews.author: Rob Carnevale

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a pure nostalgia bath for a generation. The '80s soundtrack sets the tone for spotting more pop-culture references than you can imagine, and spotting them is a lot of fun. But it's also pure Spielberg magic.
reviews.author: Brad Keefe

reviews.text: Just as Ready Player One moves back and forth between fantasy and reality, it's difficult not to admire the facility with which Spielberg oscillates between this sort of sprawling, popcorn-munching exercise and a character-driven historical drama.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: The film excels in its hectically brilliant action sequences, where the screen seethes with energy, anarchy and in-jokes.
reviews.author: Adam Sweeting

reviews.text: Worth the hype and is definitely one of the appointment films worth seeing so far in 2018.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: The beauty, the variety and the universality of this gigantic adventure, which firmly aspires to the ideals of contemporary cinema, surprises. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ruben Peralta Rigaud

reviews.text: A lively and agreeable work of fanboy art - a first-rate film fashioned from secondhand materials.
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a celebration of popular culture... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Erick Ortiz

reviews.text: Spielberg is a filmmaker with an acute narrative skill. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge (JJ) Negrete

reviews.text: The mesmerizing 'Ready Player One' is a game-changing treasure.
reviews.author: Roger Tennis

reviews.text: Back to the Future, indeed. Fanboy-pandering, CGI-driven, rehash of pop culture faves. That DeLorean was a lemon, folks.
reviews.author: James Verniere

reviews.text: What a thrill ride Spielberg has created!
reviews.author: Linda Cook

reviews.text: The film is stuffed with 80's nostalgia - look there's the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Hello Kitty, Batman and Beetlejuice! - but the film is so visually busy it overloads our senses and cast in such murk it fails to please the eye.
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: For all its faults, the movie has a sense of fun that is hard to ignore, and it's clear that it comes from a place of genuine affection for the referenced material.
reviews.author: Britton Peele

reviews.text: Ready Player One will have you hooting if you did grow up in the 1980's or '90's. And if you didn't, it might make you wish you did.
reviews.author: Graeme Tuckett

reviews.text: Spielberg wouldn't be Spielberg if he didn't know how to make this galaxy of pixels alluringly strange, a wow-machine jampacked with cool stuff.
reviews.author: Richard von Busack

reviews.text: Approximately 15 parts fun escapism and one part reflection. In a culture that's obsessed with unearthing obscure references, it will be interesting to see how the movie's fans-and I think there will be many-process the conflicting messages, if at all.
reviews.author: Eric Melin

reviews.text: The movie provides a fun time at the theater, but it's also a wildly uneven ride that runs the gamut from boring to inspiring.
reviews.author: Rob Dean

reviews.text: That's what Ready Player One ends up feeling like: a decent meal with tantalizing hints of something more complex, a Big Mac with Roquefort sprinkled on top.
reviews.author: David Sims

reviews.text: Popular songs from days gone by interspersed into the soundtrack will bring back a lot of memories for most. It's a tremendous feat by Spielberg.
reviews.author: Jeanne Kaplan

reviews.text: References to iconic films of the past to satisfy the most demanding of cinematic historians --- Much more entertaining than "Avatar".
reviews.author: David Kaplan

reviews.text: An eye-popping, nostalgia-fuelled thrill ride to make any nerd explode with delight.
reviews.author: Larushka Ivan-Zadeh

reviews.text: The plot's not going to tax anyone over the age of 12, but Spielberg crams the screen with visuals eye-popping enough to make viewers not care .
reviews.author: Bob Mondello

reviews.text: I'm now convinced there isn't any kind of movie Steven Spielberg can't master.
reviews.author: Michael Heaton

reviews.text: And yet, for all those weaknesses, this is a Steven Spielberg film, of the kind only Steven Spielberg can make. Big, raucous, heartfelt, referential, and unabashed in celebrating the culture he has always loved.
reviews.author: Richard Whittaker

reviews.text: For those looking for Ready Player One to condemn the digi-verse as a destructive force against human connection, find another movie. Spielberg's mindbending joyride won't quit even when the head-spinning spectacle hits sensory overload. Game on.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: It's nostalgia for the sake of nostalgia, and by the time its end credits roll, one wonders if there was anything worth being nostalgic about in the first place.
reviews.author: Erik Henriksen

reviews.text: [A] heaping helping of exhilarating summer popcorn spectacle delivered ahead of schedule for springtime... Steven Spielberg at the top of his game...
reviews.author: Mark Hughes

reviews.text: Steven Spielberg shakes off his pop cinema cobwebs with a spectacle that combines state-of-the-art CGI with breakneck action and heartwarming characters.
reviews.author: Jamie Dunn

reviews.text: This is fanboy fellatio and I found it all almost unbearably depressing.
reviews.author: Sean Burns

reviews.text: Rylance infuses "Ready Player One" with the warmth and spark of humanity it needs to transcend its VR roots and become something meaningful.
reviews.author: Greg Maki

reviews.text: Une adaptation libre du roman qui en suit les grandes lignes et qui en capture l'essence, mais qui sait aussi s'en éloigner afin de devenir une uvre de cinéma à part entière. [Full review in French]
reviews.author: Kevin N. Laforest

reviews.text: Filled with intense action scenes leavened by humorous interludes, it's an entertaining ride from start to finish.
reviews.author: Christopher Llewellyn Reed

reviews.text: A bountiful, overflowing buffet of just about everything a movie lover would ever want, served up by a superstar director who loves movies just as much as we do.
reviews.author: Neil Pond

reviews.text: The scenes of millions of things happening at once are skillfully made, to be sure, but they're still visually busy to the point of numbness instead of energization. The action has verve but no soul.
reviews.author: Dan Schindel

reviews.text: It's unlikely to find its way in to a Spielberg top 10, but nonetheless it's another crowdpleaser from the master.
reviews.author: Matt Neal

reviews.text: It overuses '80s nostalgia as shorthand for genuine emotional involvement, and it presents us with a rapturous digital wonderworld only to sternly lecture us that reality is the better value.
reviews.author: Ty Burr

reviews.text: What the film lacks in substance, it makes up for in style.
reviews.author: Calvin Wilson

reviews.text: With Ready Player One, Spielberg finally gets into self-spoofing, tackling his dominant era-the 1980s-with a sense of humour, while remaining plenty reverent to the pop culture universe he wrought.
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: Gamers will get a kick out of this nearly non-stop racing movie loaded with familiar pop culture images.
reviews.author: Steve Crum

reviews.text: A pop culture banquet, Spielberg's latest may fail to thrill, but it sure does please the eye.
reviews.author: Joanna Langfield

reviews.text: A nostalgic thirst trap with no reverence for the pop culture moments it deploys haphazardly.
reviews.author: Cameron Williams

reviews.text: Ready Player One has no obligation to be a rigorous intellectual exercise, even if it amounts to a wasted opportunity...it doesn't have to be so facile, either. Maybe next time the screenwriters shouldn't set the difficulty mode to easy.
reviews.author: Inkoo Kang

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a tender tribute to gamers from a filmmaker who doesn't really appear to understand or empathise with them.
reviews.author: Jason Di Rosso

reviews.text: A thrill-a-minute, virtual reality roller coaster ride riddled with allusions to pop culture and classic computer games.
reviews.author: Kam Williams

reviews.text: The action scenes are thrilling and there is just enough poignant self-critique and meta-commentary to make it more than just empty nostalgia.
reviews.author: Scott Mendelson

reviews.text: There has never been a director better at the craft of cinematic storytelling, and there has never been a story more suited to that craft than this one.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: Conjures plenty of empty spectacle...but doesn't underpin it with characters that move beyond the generic or, more crucially, the productively sharp satire that just maybe could have saved this ain't-it-cool story from itself.
reviews.author: Peter Canavese

reviews.text: Electrifying visuals and state-of-the-art showmanship can't mask the fact that Steven Spielberg's latest is essentially a hollow vehicle.
reviews.author: Anna Storm

reviews.text: Its plot is complexity itself, but its "kids save the world" soul is simple and earnest as opposed to earth shattering. With apologies to Bill and Ted, it's an excellent adventure, and let's leave it at that.
reviews.author: Kenneth Turan

reviews.text: For every obscure sci-fi nod, there's a crowd-pleasing Spielbergian trope: Scrappy hero crushing on an independent gal? Check. Friends banding together? Got 'em. Greedy corporate villain? Yep.
reviews.author: Sara Stewart

reviews.text: It's been a while since I've had such a good time watching a movie at the cinema. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge Rivera Rubio

reviews.text: Ready Player One won't ever be confused with one of Spielberg's best, but it's a fascinating, frustrating, and entertaining microcosm of his artistic acumen.
reviews.author: J.R. Kinnard

reviews.text: The movie is wall-to-wall pop culture references, and while that's exhausting and tedious, it's also inevitable that you it will manage to push your own specific nostalgia buttons.
reviews.author: Vivian Kane

reviews.text: Confusing exhaustion with exhilaration, after awhile 'Ready Player One' becomes more an assault on the senses than a pleasant diversion.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: There is never a genuine sense of wonder or excitement to these sights, mainly because there is rarely a real sense of exploration or discovery within this virtual world.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: It's a theme park ride but not the rollercoaster Spielberg hopes. More like It's a Small Virtual World, careening through gamer nirvana, jerking viewers to and fro among everything Gen X retro.
reviews.author: Steve Persall

reviews.text: Aside from its sci-fi adventure essence, Player poses semi-significant questions of identity, and the pros and cons of remaking oneself in a digital dimension.
reviews.author: Barry Paris

reviews.text: Ready Player One is like a two hour serving of Frosted Flakes with every toy in the box. The pop culture references are hurled nonstop.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: Competent, occasionally rousing entertainment that nonetheless left me a little bummed.
reviews.author: Gary Thompson

reviews.text: Mr. Spielberg navigates this warehouse with his usual dexterity, loading every frame with information without losing the clarity and momentum of the story.
reviews.author: A.O. Scott

reviews.text: It is boring with an almost nuclear boringness.
reviews.author: Nigel Andrews

reviews.text: The special effects team create technical marvels, which are as thrilling as going on a theme-park ride.
reviews.author: Randy Myers

reviews.text: Steven Spielberg's dizzying, dazzling VR fantasia of pop culture is something to behold. Movie fans will be in hog heaven.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: In some sense, this is the ultimate development of the fast, smooth, virtuosic style Spielberg has honed over the decades, which borrows heavily from advertising and depends on our instant recognition of fleeting visual cues.
reviews.author: Jake Wilson

reviews.text: Ready Player One is entertaining enough, and it's certainly well-made, but what truly stands out is the filmmaker's prevailing-present sense of bemused disgust at the way his offspring are spending their time.
reviews.author: Bilge Ebiri

reviews.text: A fun popcorn flick and a great free-for-all of pop culture that only someone with Steven Spielberg's muscle could pull together.
reviews.author: Scott Chitwood

reviews.text: Ready Player One should make fans of 80s movies, music and video games geek out, but it - and the convoluted way the story's unveiled - might alienate others.
reviews.author: Glenn Sumi

reviews.text: Frenetic and dense action sequences engage, but seldom thrill. And threats to the heroes' lives don't feel convincing...While Sheridan and Cooke create personable characters, they lack the sizzling chemistry needed to punch through the artifice.
reviews.author: Dann Gire

reviews.text: While Ready Player One will probably never be called a Spielberg classic, watch this movie for the classic feeling that only Spielberg can provide: the simple joy of being swept away at the movies.
reviews.author: Shyama Krishna Kumar

reviews.text: A sci-fi film with a heart, it revolves around true love, friendship and loyalty. Not once does Spielberg's passion for creating spectacular cinematic movie-going experience, overshadow his story's underlying message.
reviews.author: Renuka Vyavahare

reviews.text: [Steven] Spielberg delivers this charm that has been missing from film in the digital age and I love that.
reviews.author: Steph Cozza

reviews.text: Ready Player One is enjoyably diverting and speaks to the nerd in all of us in some shape or form.
reviews.author: Chris Stuckmann

reviews.text: The action is breathless and non-stop, both in the virtual reality and the reality reality, but wallowing in '80s nostalgia is only so much fun for so long.
reviews.author: Christy Lemire

reviews.text: What extraordinary visuals this films conjures up, with images that appear and disappear like quicksilver memes.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: An impressive work of technical showmanship, Ready Player One nevertheless falls short of recapturing that old-school Spielberg blockbuster magic.
reviews.author: Sandy Schaefer

reviews.text: Extraordinarily entertaining for the most part, with its numerous charms only capable of shining brightest while in the hands of the man who inspired Cline's imagination to begin with.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: Spielberg's celebration of the '80s pop culture maelstrom he helped to create is a bizarre, energetically vibrant piece of dystopian science fiction that's as fascinating as it is exasperating.
reviews.author: Sara Michelle Fetters

reviews.text: Spielberg fights mightily to keep that randomness under control, and usually succeeds. He's made a good movie. But the malleability of the story prevents it from being something more.
reviews.author: Bill Goodykoontz

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a movie designed to be embraced by the geekiest among us, and on that level it earns a high score.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: It may be just a roller coaster, but it respects itself enough to be the best rollercoaster it possibly can.
reviews.author: Rob Vaux

reviews.text: Like watching high-speed drone footage, flying over a flea market, filled with outdated game consoles, posters, forgotten DVDs and CDs. It should be fun in a geeky way, but there's little humour and character engagement
reviews.author: Liam Lacey

reviews.text: Steven Spielberg has delivered a perfect blockbuster for our nostalgia-driven times.
reviews.author: James Mottram

reviews.text: Spielberg creates two distinct worlds - the brightly-coloured, neon lit OASIS and the dull, bleak 'real world' - and has tremendous fun playing in both of them.
reviews.author: Jo Berry

reviews.text: Ready Player One is vintage Spielberg - a noble hero with good intentions on a quest against the bad guy who just doesn't get it. It's fun, it's entertaining and it's good. It's just not amazing.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: Ready Player One feels like a culmination of the era of pop-culture that we live in, a carnival-like celebration of geekdom that only Steven Spielberg could have made.
reviews.author: Rohan Naahar

reviews.text: If "Ready Player One" is tedious at times, it's also oodles of fun at others ...
reviews.author: Michael O'Sullivan

reviews.text: By a whisker, Spielberg wins the race against his own material.
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: It's a boldly attempted strike against the monolithic corporatization of fan service, and arguably one of the few films that defines dystopia as nothing less than a marketplace of trademarked, cross-promotional intellectual property.
reviews.author: Eric Henderson

reviews.text: I've seen "Ready Player One," and now my eyeballs need a vacation.
reviews.author: Soren Andersen

reviews.text: It's clear Spielberg is intrigued by VR only in the context of cinematic spectacle; any interesting observations about the virtual realm are incidental.
reviews.author: Luke Buckmaster

reviews.text: This is a hugely entertaining thrill ride that opens up further the more times you press play.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: Again and again, the movie's setting - and Spielberg's practiced craftsmanship - help turn some of its manifold potential bugs into features.
reviews.author: Glen Weldon

reviews.text: No drama or tension, but in terms of bold, brash, unashamed blockbusting popcorn munchers, Ready Player One entertains.
reviews.author: Adam Fresco

reviews.text: Might mark the beginning of a new era in filmmaking or the end of an old one, but either way it feels like a failed experiment in building a new story on the carcasses of old movies, TV shows and video games.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a grand act of stage management, but it lacks the clean narrative punch of Spielberg's early masterpieces.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: It's basically a pop culture lover's dream come true, a film that pays homage to a time that gave us some incredible films, games, and music, all wrapped up as a gift to us from one of the greatest directors of all time.
reviews.author: Jeff Beck

reviews.text: It's good to see Spielberg, at 71, still finding new forms of cinematic language with which to express his humanism.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: Spielberg deftly switches between the blinking, bleeping world of the OASIS and the grayer, grittier reality outside. Meanwhile, there's a touch of innocence that never lets us forget this dazzling spectacle is still basically a fairy tale.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: So how does it all come together? Pretty marvellously from a visual point of view, maybe less so from one a narrative one.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: So buckle up, take a deep breath and enjoy the ride. It's sensational.
reviews.author: Garry McConnachie

reviews.text: It's The Matrix meets everything!
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: Demonstrating his enduring ability to entertain while embracing the latest technology and remaining relevant to a modern audience, Spielberg proves he's still Hollywood's number one player.
reviews.author: Chris Hunneysett

reviews.text: At its best, Ready Player One unfolds like unstructured free time for Hollywood's biggest kid, unleashed in a playground he helped construct, one Amblin entertainment at a time.
reviews.author: A.A. Dowd

reviews.text: It is without a question one of the year's most energetic, visually rewarding, and ultimately exhausting motion pictures.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: It's bittersweet seeing Spielberg reach the apex of his visual craft in a vapid love letter to consumer culture.
reviews.author: Vincent Mancini

reviews.text: While I'm not sure READY PLAYER ONE stands on its own as a distinct work, it can't be denied that it is what it is and is the best possible version of Cline's novel that could have been realistically done.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: Ultimately, a likeable cast, [Mark] Rylance's performance is especially memorable, an imaginative story and Spielberg's ability to meld mirth, mystery and pop culture ensure that Ready Player One is a must-see.
reviews.author: George M. Thomas

reviews.text: Spielberg has pulled off this marketing stunt of a movie without appearing cynical. The story takes place half in the VR world and half in reality, but the characters are, surprisingly, both likeable and accessible.
reviews.author: Chris Newbould

reviews.text: A fun nostalgia bomb, and a great adventure.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: If Ready Player One had been directed by a 26-year-old, the movie world would be flipping out over the new visionary on the map.
reviews.author: Richard Roeper

reviews.text: For those who get their fix through pop nostalgia, "Ready Player One" is - for better or worse - an indulgent, dizzying overdose.
reviews.author: Jake Coyle

reviews.text: Steven Spielberg's sci-fi popcorn fantasia Ready Player One feels like a movie made by someone in his 20s rather than his 70s.
reviews.author: Chris Nashawaty

reviews.text: The most enjoyable Steven Spielberg movie in over 15 years
reviews.author: Jason Guerrasio

reviews.text: Steven Spielberg doesn't age. He just levels up.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: Ready Player One's an entertaining nostalgia trip that wears its influences proudly but throws them at such dizzying force that sometimes you feel like you're buried under Chuck E. Cheese tokens.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: Ready Player One is visually pleasing but at the end of the day, it's just another film heavy on Easter eggs and short on character development.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: It's a love letter to the things we love by someone who is responsible for some of the things we love most
reviews.author: Robert Kojder

reviews.text: It tricks you into thinking it has the stakes, distracting with the old razzle dazzle and hoping you don't pop open the hood and kick the tires on this story, which turns out to be a lemon.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: Ready Player One is first and foremost an action adventure movie, and Spielberg's filmmaking instincts wisely sense that audiences will be fascinated by the rich and relentlessly shape-shifting world of OASIS above all else.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: Eye-catching images, forgettable development. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yago García

reviews.text: Despite some sensory overload, there's no denying Steven Spielberg is a master at crafting mind-blowing action sequences. Might as well jump to it.
reviews.author: Mara Reinstein

reviews.text: The classic young hero quest, 21st century style.
reviews.author: Angie Errigo

reviews.text: The amount of fun you'll have while watching this is mostly dependent on your skills at playing "Spot the pop culture reference". [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mario Alegre

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a love letter to '80s pop culture, jam packed with references... Beneath its retro glad rags, however, the story is deceptively layered.
reviews.author: Vicky Roach

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a pleasurable, fun ride filled with nostalgic references that will bring back the kid in you and make you wish you can stay young like Peter Pan.
reviews.author: Wilson Morales

reviews.text: There's a lot to like about Ready Player One and, at times, it shows glimmers of the kind of fantasy adventure that made the words "A Steven Spielberg Film" so sacred to movie fans in the 80s.
reviews.author: Victoria Luxford

reviews.text: Ready Player One is the jazzy, flashy, tripped-out, super-caffeinated kid version of the director many of us grew up loving, and many subsequent directors grew up aping.
reviews.author: Stephen Rebello

reviews.text: Ultimately Ready Player One is like being in a movie-themed pinball machine, as Spielberg delivers an optimistic human story with effects heavy nostalgic referential spectacle on top.
reviews.author: Jack Bottomley

reviews.text: Ready Player One works in different layers and levels, and even if you don't know each of the elements that appear on the screen, the complexity in each of the action sequences is enough to enjoy it. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sergio López Aguirre

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a thrilling adventure, not a nostalgia parade.
reviews.author: Matt Goldberg

reviews.text: It's dazzling stuff. Recently, a generation of directors has been paying homage to Spielberg's popcorn films, but with Ready Player One he proves with stunning aplomb that no one does Spielberg quite like Spielberg.
reviews.author: Nicholas Barber

reviews.text: The winning factor that binds the film together is the friendship aspect with the players meeting up to deal with IOI's real life maniacal behaviour.
reviews.author: Katherine McLaughlin

reviews.text: You're left with the overriding sensation of a master playing someone else's greatest hits.
reviews.author: Philip De Semlyen

reviews.text: This film, and the virtual reality it's set in, is a visual and aural bombardment.
reviews.author: Joseph Walsh

reviews.text: Steven Spielberg brings Ernest Cline's bestselling, nostalgia-fueled sci-fi novel Ready Player One to the big screen, and offers up a beautiful homage with a lot of heart.
reviews.author: Rick Marshall

reviews.text: A magic carpet ride whose trailer (deliberately?) doesn't do it justice, Ready Player One is Steven Spielberg having the most fun in decades as the curator-in-chief of all our yesterdays. And it's contagious.
reviews.author: Harry Guerin

reviews.text: For movie lovers this particular fusion of all of Spielberg's artistic sensibilities provides them with 140 of pure cinematic delight-Full Review in Spanish
reviews.author: Juanma Fernández París

reviews.text: This may be the worst film of Spielberg's career...
reviews.author: Travis Johnson

reviews.text: A love letter to pop culture, movies and fans, filled with that classic Spielberg blockbuster magic. A hell of a ride at the movies! [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fico Cangiano

reviews.text: RP1 may not be perfect, but it places Spielberg back at his best.
reviews.author: Jo-Anne Rowney

reviews.text: How much do you really want to think about Back To The Future when you're having a pretty mediocre present watching Ready Player One?
reviews.author: Fionnuala Halligan

reviews.text: Some solid whizz-bang material, but feels like cod roe when it should be caviar.
reviews.author: David Jenkins

reviews.text: Its vision of a world fixated on cultural nursery food has a spiky topicality and an occasionally piercing satirical bite.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: It's a paean to pop culture, a love letter to the '80s and a glorious, good-hearted adventure that will please kids and remind grown-ups how they felt watching Spielberg's early works the first time around.
reviews.author: Rosie Fletcher

reviews.text: A thrilling joy ride that encompasses every Spielberg trope you can think of and throws them back out at you through some of the most gorgeous scenes you may see on screen all year.
reviews.author: Rebecca Lewis

reviews.text: Ready Player One reminds us yet again of Spielberg's extraordinary versatility. It is made with his customary fluency and shows an offbeat humour you wouldn't normally associate with him.
reviews.author: Geoffrey Macnab

reviews.text: ... a bumper pack of cinematic Viagra for a film that surges forward improbably for the first wildly propulsive hour, before inevitably collapsing into a flaccid heap, long before its epic, overlong running time is done.
reviews.author: Kevin Maher

reviews.text: Spielberg balances sugar-rush nostalgia with an involving story to create a pure, uncynical, cinematic ride that recaptures the magic of his early films.
reviews.author: Jonathan Pile

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a wild thrill ride that takes pop culture nostalgia to dizzying new heights.
reviews.author: Matthew Turner

reviews.text: It's a tale gloriously steeped in nostalgia, and marks an ambitious undertaking for Spielberg, but it simply couldn't have been left in more reliable hands.
reviews.author: Stefan Pape

reviews.text: Spielberg gets his game face on with spectacular results. One extended scene - no spoilers! - is as fun as cinema gets.
reviews.author: Jamie Graham

reviews.text: Ready Player One is just one big bowl of spectacular popcorn fun. Another Steven Spielberg classic.
reviews.author: Kit Bowen

reviews.text: A fun romp that reinforces Spielberg's reputation as a master of his craft.
reviews.author: Conner Schwerdtfeger

reviews.text: A remarkable crowd pleaser that immeasurably improves upon the book, full of wacked-out dazzling visuals but still easy to follow and enjoy, even for non-gamers.
reviews.author: Leonardo Faierman

reviews.text: [Spielberg] loves pop culture, loves film, loves video games and misfit kids and the 1980s, and Ready Player One is his good-natured tribute to all of those things and, yes, even to himself.
reviews.author: Meredith Borders
