reviews.text: Ready Player One, for better or worse, opens with Van Halen's "Jump" and never looks back (up to you if that's a good or bad sign).
reviews.author: Matt Donato

reviews.text: You want total immersion into a fantasy world? Spielberg is definitely your guy.
reviews.author: Joe Gross

reviews.text: It isn't so much a movie about loving old video games and other cultural artifacts. It's about loving to love those things, which makes Steven Spielberg's film adaptation of the bestselling novel feel hollow.
reviews.author: Evan Narcisse

reviews.text: Spielberg's dizzying foray into '80s pop culture fandom is a return to pure pop escapism.
reviews.author: Jordan Ruimy

reviews.text: The cultural references crammed in everywhere should have given the movie heart, but instead they feel like contractual obligations.
reviews.author: Matthew Razak

reviews.text: While it's not particularly emotional and I was disappointed by how many questions are left open by its shallow visits to the real world, it's still a lot of fun.
reviews.author: Alanah Pearce

reviews.text: The adaptation of the Ernest Cline novel is a supremely entertaining crowd-pleaser, and a film that brings something to the table everyone should be wistful for: that classic Spielberg touch.
reviews.author: David Crow

reviews.text: There is a heart beating at the center of The Goonies, E.T., Raiders of the Lost Ark, and more-but in Ready Player One, audiences will instead find a gleaming, digital, golden Easter egg... for many, that will be enough.
reviews.author: Joanna Robinson

reviews.text: Ready Player One is a nostalgic trip back to all things 80's and like the Oasis, the film gives the audience a chance to escape reality for a few hours.
reviews.author: Ashley Menzel

reviews.text: When you're watching Ready Player One, you can almost feel the legendary director sitting next to you, laughing at the references, thrilled with the action, and eating his popcorn. You definitely need popcorn for this one.
reviews.author: Brian Tallerico

reviews.text: The human frailties behind the game avatars is a reliable well of humor for Ready Player One, and the script takes full, hilarious advantage.
reviews.author: Tasha Robinson

reviews.text: A groundbreaking visual spectacle that combines all types of popular media and rolls them into one massive and must-see motion picture experience.
reviews.author: Scott Menzel

reviews.text: The cinematic equivalent of a pop-culture mashup tee.
reviews.author: Britt Hayes

reviews.text: Ready Player One is one of the most egregiously set piece-driven slices of pop cinema we've seen in a long while.
reviews.author: Jacob Knight

reviews.text: It is without question the most entertaining film Spielberg has made since Catch Me If You Can.
reviews.author: Marlow Stern

reviews.text: While the movie is visually whimsical with its design and neon colors, the weakness of the source material still pokes out.
reviews.author: Monica Castillo

reviews.text: At a certain point, though, Ready Player One wants to be appreciated as a film as well as a movie, no matter what Spielberg says. And that's where it begins to falter.
reviews.author: Dan Caffrey

reviews.text: An overabundance of pop culture references can't save Ready Player One from its own mediocrity
reviews.author: Jonathan Barkan

reviews.text: It's an accomplished and intermittently hypnotic movie. Yet you may feel like you're occupied more than you are invested.
reviews.author: Owen Gleiberman

reviews.text: A rollicking adventure through worlds both bleak and fantastic, Steven Spielberg's Ready Player One makes big changes to the specifics and structure of Ernest Cline's best-selling novel but keeps the spirit and level-up thrills intact.
reviews.author: John DeFore

reviews.text: It does not exist to stretch your mind (it does stretch your time, running a bit too long in the third act) but like the OASIS, it's a wonderful piece of escapism. Sometimes, a vacation from anything meaningful does make for an interesting ride.
reviews.author: Joi Childs

reviews.text: Eventually, "Ready Player One" becomes the very thing its characters admire, a preponderance of commercial entertainment smashed together into a singularity of blockbuster chaos.
reviews.author: Eric Kohn

synopsis: In 2045, the planet is on the brink of chaos and collapse, but people find salvation in the OASIS, an expansive virtual reality universe created by James Halliday. When Halliday dies, he promises his immense fortune to the first person to discover a digital Easter egg that's hidden somewhere in the OASIS. When young Wade Watts joins the contest, he finds himself becoming an unlikely hero in a reality-bending treasure hunt through a fantastical world of mystery, discovery and danger.
